meanings.definition: Moving or proceeding at a low speed.
meanings.sent1: The turtle was the slowest animal in the race.
meanings.sent2: The snail is known for being one of the slowest creatures on land.
meanings.sent3: The sloth's idea of a race would be the slowest competition ever.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to move at the slowest pace during the boring lecture.
meanings.sent5: The old car moved at the slowest pace, barely making progress.

meanings.definition: Taking a long time to happen or be done.
meanings.sent1: The slowest marathon runners took hours to finish the race.
meanings.sent2: The construction of the new building was one of the slowest projects in town.
meanings.sent3: The snail's attempt to cross the sidewalk was the slowest journey ever witnessed.
meanings.sent4: The growth of the tree seemed to be at the slowest rate possible.
meanings.sent5: The internet connection was at its slowest during peak hours.

meanings.definition: Less quick in understanding or learning; mentally dull.
meanings.sent1: The slowest student in the class needed extra help with the lesson.
meanings.sent2: The sloth is often seen as the slowest animal in terms of mental processing.
meanings.sent3: The computer's response was the slowest when the memory was almost full.
meanings.sent4: Her brain felt like it was moving at the slowest speed during the exam.
meanings.sent5: The elderly dog's memory was at its slowest, often forgetting where it left its toys.
